Interface DimensionLossFunction

All Superinterfaces:
LossFunction
All Known Implementing Classes:
BinaryCrossEntropy, ScaledError, SquaredError
@DomainObject @Strategy(INTERFACE) public interface DimensionLossFunction extends LossFunction
Represents a loss function that operates at the per-dimension level.

Each output dimension of a sample can have its own loss, which is then aggregated into a per-sample loss (L) or batch loss (J) by higher-level loss functions such as BatchLossFunction.

Definitions:

  • Dimension loss (l): the loss computed for a single output dimension.
  • Gradient dl/da: the derivative of the dimension loss with respect to the activation (output) of this dimension, used in backpropagation.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    float
    calculateDimensionLoss(float estimated, float target)
    Calculates the loss for a single dimension, given the estimated value and the target value.
    float
    calculateGradient_dl_da(float estimated, float target)
    Calculates the gradient of the dimension loss with respect to the activation (output) of this dimension.

  • Method Details

    • calculateDimensionLoss

      float calculateDimensionLoss(float estimated, float target)
      Calculates the loss for a single dimension, given the estimated value and the target value.
      Parameters:
      estimated - the predicted or estimated value
      target - the expected or target value
      Returns:
      the loss for this dimension as a float

    • calculateGradient_dl_da

      float calculateGradient_dl_da(float estimated, float target)
      Calculates the gradient of the dimension loss with respect to the activation (output) of this dimension. This corresponds to dl/da in backpropagation formulas.
      Parameters:
      estimated - the predicted or estimated value for this dimension
      target - the expected or target value for this dimension
      Returns:
      the gradient of the loss with respect to the activation
